CRD_MorningAfterRomance.synopsis: Morning after Karlach's romance in act 2

CRD_CoolingDownForYou.synopsis: Karlach asks her date if they know something that could cool her down the morning after Burning up for you or on subsequent nights.CRD cancels if players try to help her in her InParty dialog.
CRD_CoolingDownForYou.how_to_trigger: With Karlach as companion, use the debug book to start dating her, then go to camp night.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart.synopsis: Karlach asks to go to bed with Avatar who's dating during the Forging of the Heart camp night in act 2
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart.how_to_trigger: 1. Load SCL_Main_A, recruit and date Karlach.2. Get her second upgrade or queue Forging of the Heart camp night.3. Go to camp and speak with her.

CRD_FacingDeath.synopsis: Karlach tells players that she is about to die if they didn't learn about that till this point in the story. She should be a bit run-down during this convo, a little strained by the engine.

CRD_ROM_Date.synopsis: At camp, Karlach invites the player on a date. The dialogue will teleport them to the date location. If Henk is not available for the dialog, Honk will be instead.
CRD_ROM_Date.how_to_trigger: Gortash must have been permadefeated and Karlach has to be in the party and have an avatar romantic partner and move to CTY_Main_A. Then go a long rest. More than one might be needed specially since Orin's abduction has priority over this night.If using the origin debug book then:1. Load CTY_Main_A2. Recruit Karlach as a companion.3. "Karlach" -> "Act 3 Romance" -> "Partner Karlach"3. "Karlach" -> "Act 3 Romance" -> "Unlock romance night"

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine.synopsis: If players didn't finish Paladins of Tyr nor don't know about Karlach's infernal engine she will remind them about that. If they decide to continue without helping her she permanently leaves the party.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine.how_to_trigger: Recruit Karlach and use any of the teleporters to leave Act 1.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_15.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_15.text: Mmm... la da da... bum ba du-dumdum...

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_18.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_18.text: Oh! Gods, sorry, I was in my own world. Hi. Hello, good morning.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_18.context: NodeContext: Slightly starled/ awkward. She's super happy here but it's been so long since she's felt like this, she's a bit out of her element.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_46.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_46.text: Sorry I didn't wait around this morning. I was just... just buzzing. Didn't want to wake you.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_46.context: NodeContext: She's totally in love and energised.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_37.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_37.text: Did you sleep well last night?

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_26.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_26.text: Like the dead. The excruciatingly happy dead.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_11.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_11.text: I loved being able to touch you last night. Hold you, kiss you, all of it.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_22.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_22.text: I loved it too. More than I've ever loved anything.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_22.context: NodeContext: Subtext: 'More than I've ever loved anyONE.' She and the player will exchange 'I love yous' soon enough, but not quite yet It's probably on both of their minds though.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_5.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_5.text: Still. You looked so peaceful. I wanted to go wherever you were. But I'm me, so I did a lap of camp instead.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_5.context: NodeContext: Laughing at herself a little.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_2.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_2.text: Last night was incredible. This morning is incredible. Every moment with you is... beyond belief.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_34.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_34.context: NodeContext: Suddenly doubting, realizing this is all so good it might get taken away at any moment.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_31.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_31.text: Of course I do. Never doubt it.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_0.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_0.text: And... and nothing bad is going to happen now?

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_27.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_27.text: If our record is anything to go by, there are plenty of disasters in our future. But we'll face them together.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_33.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_33.text: In that case, bring it on.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_39.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_39.text: I guess we'd better get the day on. So much to do, so much to see... together! Wheyyy.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_39.context: NodeContext: Delighted she gets to hang out with the player all day.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_48.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_48.text: I LOVE YOU TOO! Oh my gods, I've been dying to say that.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_48.context: NodeContext: So excited, then covers her mouth with her hand sheepishly/ chuckling. (This is to highlight the sweet youthfulness behind the tough cool charisma machine

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_12.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_12.text: My gods, if I smile any bigger my face is going to crack. I'm pathetic. Besotted! And it's all your fault.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_20.context: NodeContext: A little sceptical. She just said she adores the player and they responded 'thank you'.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_19.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_19.text: I think you know better than that.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_47.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_47.text: I do. But sometimes I don't mind being lied to.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_41.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_41.text: But you're not the gilding type. Straightforward, true as the day is long.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_36.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_36.text: No, nothing bad is going to happen to us ever again.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_43.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_43.text: A beautiful lie. But I guess whatever comes, we'll be there. Together. That's enough for me.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_50.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_50.text: I much more than like you too.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_50.context: NodeContext: With sweet gravitas. Very meaningful for her to be able to say this.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_7.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_7.context: NodeContext: Karlach asked if the player still likes her and the player responded 'About that.' Karlach laughs at first but then is terrified they're serious.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_8.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_8.text: No, I'm sorry - it was just a joke. Of course I still like you.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_45.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_45.text: My gods, I think my heart almost stopped completely. Don't scare me like that, you scallywag!

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_10.text: Nothing bad is going to happen now. Not now that we're finally so... so close. Right?

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_6.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_6.text: I'm sorry, Karlach, but I think... I think last night was a mistake.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_25.context: NodeContext: Player is breaking up with her after their night together. She did NOT see this coming. This should be from a real crack in the heart.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_38.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_38.text: All right. Well fuck you too then. Using me like I'm a fucking grenade in your pack. Well, you did your damage. Are you happy?
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_38.context: NodeContext: Goes from heartbreak to justified fury very quickly if the player breaks up with her after their night together.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_14.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_14.text: Get out of my face. Wanker.
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_14.context: NodeContext: Goes from heartbreak to justified fury very quickly if the player breaks up with her after their night together.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_44.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_44.text: No, no, I'm sorry. I was only messing around.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_13.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_13.text: Well, I don't just 'like' you. I much more than like you.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_16.speaker: Player
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_16.text: Last night I dreamt a bird was singing to me. And look, there she is.

CRD_MorningAfterRomance_23.speaker: Karlach
CRD_MorningAfterRomance_23.context: NodeContext: Looking around, humming to herself, not staring at the player

CRD_CoolingDownForYou_4.speaker: Karlach
CRD_CoolingDownForYou_4.text: Hey, soldier - you said you might try cooling me down. Any leads?

CRD_CoolingDownForYou_3.speaker: Karlach
CRD_CoolingDownForYou_3.context: NodeContext: Excited response to 'Let me try something'

CRD_CoolingDownForYou_1.speaker: Player
CRD_CoolingDownForYou_1.text: Nothing is coming to mind. Sorry.

CRD_CoolingDownForYou_2.speaker: Karlach
CRD_CoolingDownForYou_2.text: There's got to be something, right? Something cold - or water! Or maybe if you were less... burnable. There's a thought, right?

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_20.text: Hey, soldier. I thought I might come visit you later. When everyone's asleep.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_20.context: NodeContext: Shyly. Referring to the fact that her engine is fixed.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_0.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_0.text: Of course. Nothing would make me happier.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_10.text: Me too. See you later. I can't wait.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_3.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_3.text: Shall I knock the others out to hurry them up?

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_5.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_5.text: Haha! Please. We've waited long enough, I think.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_12.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_12.text: See you later. I can't wait.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_2.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_2.text: Of course you can. But you should know I may not want to cross certain lines physically.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_16.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_16.text: That's perfectly fine. I just want to be with you. No expectations. No pressure. Just us.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_11.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_11.text: I'm not sure, Karlach. I think maybe this has gone far enough.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_4.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_4.text: You mean you - you aren't interested anymore. In me.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_4.context: NodeContext: Perplexed. Trying to see if she's hearing the player right. She wasn't expecting a breakup.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_9.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_9.text: Oh man. My heart. I - I really had the wrong end of the stick there.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_9.context: NodeContext: A bit blown away the player is breaking up with her now.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_8.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_8.text: I'll - I mean - I need to do some thinking. Thanks for telling me, I guess. I - sleep well, I guess.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_8.context: NodeContext: A bit blown away the player is breaking up with her now.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_14.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_14.text: Honestly, I'm not sure I ever was. I just wanted to see where things would go.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_18.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_18.text: Bit badly done, to jerk me around like that. You may not care about this, but I did. I did.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_18.context: NodeContext: Player is breaking up with her in a very cavalier way, which she doesn't appreciate.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_15.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_15.text: You don't have to love me. You don't even have to like me. But you do have to treat me with respect.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_19.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_19.text: Do some thinking on how you treat people, soldier. This isn't the way.
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_19.context: NodeContext: Scoffing. Really not impressed with how the player is treating her (cavalier breakup)

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_6.speaker: Player
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_6.text: Argh, I'm just confused. I don't know what I want.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_1.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_1.text: But I do. And I want you. Or I thought I did, anyway.

CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ForgingOfTheHeart_17.text: I want to be with someone who's sure about me. Someone who wants me as much as I want them. It seems like that isn't you.

CRD_FacingDeath_7.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_7.text: You saw Gortash, didn't you? What the fuck was he doing down there? Is all of this because of him?

CRD_FacingDeath_45.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_45.text: I don't know how this plot fits together yet. But we will stop him.

CRD_FacingDeath_50.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_50.text: I was his bodyguard. I looked after him with my life. I trusted him more than anything.

CRD_FacingDeath_48.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_48.text: He gave me away to Zariel just for kicks. He ruined my life just when it was starting.

CRD_FacingDeath_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_25.text: And now he'd use up the entire Sword Coast.

CRD_FacingDeath_4.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_4.text: He has to die. And I'm gonna be the one who kills him.
CRD_FacingDeath_4.context: NodeContext: Furious, straining from the heat

CRD_FacingDeath_1.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_1.text: We'll do it together. Whatever it takes.

CRD_FacingDeath_30.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_30.text: He can't get away with what he's done. To me, to us. He won't get away with it!

CRD_FacingDeath_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_17.text: I can feel it. The engine. It's getting hotter. Louder. It's going to blow, if we don't find another way to fix it.

CRD_FacingDeath_49.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_49.text: I can feel it. The engine. It's getting hotter. Louder. It's going to blow, if we don't find another way to fix it.

CRD_FacingDeath_16.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_16.text: I can feel it. The engine. It's getting hotter. Louder. I feel like... like it might burn out completely. And soon, if I don't find some way to fix it.

CRD_FacingDeath_52.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_52.text: You know, Zariel may have put the fucking thing in, but Gortash gave her the go-ahead. You expect this shit from devils. But not from the people you care about.

CRD_FacingDeath_35.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_35.text: Let's get to the city. Got business there I'm highly fucking keen to attend to.
CRD_FacingDeath_35.context: NodeContext: It's ambiguous here whether she's talking about killing Gortash or getting her engine fixed.

CRD_FacingDeath_38.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_38.text: Do you know this engine inside of me is going to blow? If I don't find an infernal mechanic, I'm finished.

CRD_FacingDeath_36.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_36.text: Do you know what's inside me? An infernal engine. It burns as hot as the Hells, and it's been running in overdrive since I left Avernus.

CRD_FacingDeath_44.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_44.text: Zariel may have put the fucking thing in, but Gortash gave her the go-ahead. You expect this shit from devils. But not from the people you care about.

CRD_FacingDeath_40.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_40.text: I need to get myself fixed in time to make him pay.

CRD_FacingDeath_22.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_22.text: How can we fix your engine?

CRD_FacingDeath_28.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_28.text: An infernal mechanic could do it - and quickly. I'm hanging on, but just by my fingertips.

CRD_FacingDeath_34.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_34.text: I might know someone - a tiefling weaponsmith we met in the druids' grove.

CRD_FacingDeath_46.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_46.text: If he went on to Baldur's Gate, we might be able to find him. He owes you a favour after what you did, right?

CRD_FacingDeath_11.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_11.text: There must be someone we can consult in Baldur's Gate.

CRD_FacingDeath_19.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_19.text: I'm not going out yet - got business with a motherfucker first.

CRD_FacingDeath_8.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_8.text: We can keep our eyes peeled, but I'm more concerned about the giant illithid brain that just left for the city.

CRD_FacingDeath_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_20.text: I want to live to fight it. Not burn out before I get the chance.

CRD_FacingDeath_12.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_12.text: I've got a long list of evil fucks to deal with. And I'm not going out until I do.

CRD_FacingDeath_9.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_9.text: Then I need to find an infernal mechanic - and quickly. I'm hanging on, but just by my fingertips.

CRD_FacingDeath_0.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_0.text: If you're going to explode, I suggest you stay far away from me.

CRD_FacingDeath_29.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_29.text: I'm more likely to implode than blow up, more's the pity. Wouldn't mind taking out a few cultists on my way out the door. But better if it doesn't come to that.

CRD_FacingDeath_21.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_21.text: I need to find an infernal mechanic - quickly. I'm hanging on, but just by my fingertips.

CRD_FacingDeath_42.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_42.text: You bet your arse I am. And I won't stop 'til that fucker is dead!

CRD_FacingDeath_5.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_5.text: Not if I kill him first.

CRD_FacingDeath_18.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_18.text: I won't know peace 'til I've dug my thumbs into his eyes. 'Til I've ripped his throat out with my teeth. Hear that, Gortash?! I'm coming for you!

CRD_FacingDeath_51.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_51.text: It seems he's a servant of Bane, as Ketheric served Myrkul. Who knows what powers he's gained since you knew him?

CRD_FacingDeath_3.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_3.text: I'd never have protected a Banite, even a decade ago. I looked after that fucker with my life. I trusted him.

CRD_FacingDeath_6.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_6.text: He gave me away to Zariel without a second thought, and now he's looking to ruin the entire Sword Coast.

CRD_FacingDeath_33.speaker: Player
CRD_FacingDeath_33.text: We'll find out when we get to Baldur's Gate.

CRD_FacingDeath_14.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_14.text: Whatever the fuck he's been up to in the last ten years, we have to stop him. He can't just keep ruining people's lives. He can't get away with it!

CRD_FacingDeath_32.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_32.text: He used me up and gave me away when he was done with me. Didn't matter how much I trusted him.

CRD_FacingDeath_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_FacingDeath_10.text: I heard about what happened. Ketheric. Myrkul. And Gortash. What the fuck was he doing down there? Is all of this because of him?

CRD_ROM_Date_53.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_53.text: I need to be alone, all right? I'm very fucking confused right now.
CRD_ROM_Date_53.context: NodeContext: Hurt. Not angry, but confused.

CRD_ROM_Date_78.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_78.text: I've figured it out. Exactly what I want to do with you.

CRD_ROM_Date_89.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_89.text: I want to go on a date. A first date. No weapons, no monsters, no mysterious voices... just you and me and dinner.

CRD_ROM_Date_95.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_95.context: NodeContext: Ingenue essence, not a demand but almost a plead.

CRD_ROM_Date_38.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_38.text: I'd love to go out with you.

CRD_ROM_Date_130.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_130.text: Yes! Amazing. Put on your least bloody tunic and meet me back here. Eee, I'm so excited!
CRD_ROM_Date_130.context: NodeContext: Huge smile, super happy, does a little dance.

CRD_ROM_Date_108.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_108.text: Give me a beat to run ahead - I want to make sure everything's absolutely perfect. See you there!

CRD_ROM_Date_26.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Player walks into Dancing Lute Tavern and spots Karlach, who's already sitting at one of the tables. It's decorated in a white tablecloth and candles. She beckons you over. Please reach out to Greg for poses/staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_194.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_194.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player takes a seat oppsite Karlach. They both pick up menus (menu is like a paper, not book type) and read them over, Karlach glancing at the player nervously from time to time.

CRD_ROM_Date_176.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_176.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player telling her she looks nice. Warm, pleased.

CRD_ROM_Date_73.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_73.text: I feel you could've made a bit more of an effort.

CRD_ROM_Date_45.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_45.text: I refuse to find out you're an arsehole at this late juncture, so I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that.

CRD_ROM_Date_69.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_69.text: Hmm. Baldurian seafood stew. No thank you. What do you think you'll have?
CRD_ROM_Date_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: She smiles, scans the menu again. (menu is like a piece of paper, not book type)

CRD_ROM_Date_67.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_67.text: I actually think the seafood stew sounds nice.

CRD_ROM_Date_72.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_72.text: Maybe I shouldn't knock what I haven't tried.
CRD_ROM_Date_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: REcovering from having said it sounds nasty earlier

CRD_ROM_Date_173.speaker: Tender Henk
CRD_ROM_Date_173.context: CinematicNodeContext: A bored-looking half-orc drags himself over and grunts at the players (walk few step to the player then talk) Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: A grunt meaning 'go ahead and order'.

CRD_ROM_Date_79.speaker: Tender Honk
CRD_ROM_Date_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: A bored-looking half-orc drags himself over and grunts at the players (walk few step to the player then talk) Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_188.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_188.text: We'll both have the seafood stew, please. And two glasses of...
CRD_ROM_Date_188.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

CRD_ROM_Date_215.speaker: Tender Henk
CRD_ROM_Date_215.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter takes the menus and ambles away.NodeContext: Takign the order with disdain

CRD_ROM_Date_56.speaker: Tender Honk
CRD_ROM_Date_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter takes the menus and ambles away.NodeContext: Takign the order with disdain

CRD_ROM_Date_105.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_105.text: So! You're an adventurer, right? How's that going?

CRD_ROM_Date_22.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_22.text: You've been by my side for a lot of it, you know.

CRD_ROM_Date_217.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_217.text: I know, but this is our first date, remember? Tonight, you're a mystery to me.

CRD_ROM_Date_18.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_18.text: More difficult than expected. The baddies around here are very bad.

CRD_ROM_Date_21.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_21.text: Eh. Bad-ish. Not trying to one-up the local villains, of course, but man, have I seen some shit.

CRD_ROM_Date_198.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_198.text: But hang on, this isn't first date talk. Tonight, I'm a mystery to you, and you're a mystery to me.

CRD_ROM_Date_163.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_163.text: I'm not sure I can pretend I don't already love you.

CRD_ROM_Date_170.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_170.text: It's all I can do to keep my hands to myself, anyway. We're terrible at this.

CRD_ROM_Date_37.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_37.text: That's true. We ought to behave like we've only just met.

CRD_ROM_Date_229.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_229.text: Exactly. Anything you'd like to know about your enigmatic new paramour?

CRD_ROM_Date_239.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_239.text: Never thought I'd be the type to fall for a fatale like you, but there's a sweetness to you, just beneath the surface. It's irresistible.

CRD_ROM_Date_4.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_4.text: In your case, it's practically a vital organ. Though the veil seems to lift that little bit every day, and I just see... you.
CRD_ROM_Date_4.context: NodeContext: Starts with a laugh; by the end, a look of absolutely love.

CRD_ROM_Date_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_20.text: Gods, I'm terrible at this. Trying to have a first date, but I feel like I've known you all my life.

CRD_ROM_Date_12.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_12.text: Want to get out of here?

CRD_ROM_Date_133.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_133.text: No! Yes. No - we came to have a nice date, and that's what we're going to do. Go on: date me. I dare you.

CRD_ROM_Date_52.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_52.text: You're right. So... erm... where did you grow up?

CRD_ROM_Date_49.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_49.text: Right here in Baldur's Gate, more or less. My folks are long gone now, but they raised me in the Outer City. Dad was a porter in town, mum did laundry. Still think of her when I smell clean sheets.

CRD_ROM_Date_126.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_126.text: We were poorer than dirt, but my gods we had fun. What about you?

CRD_ROM_Date_82.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_82.text: It's very faint... but I think that a foster family looked after me before I ended up in the Temple of Bhaal.

CRD_ROM_Date_84.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_84.text: Wonder if they're still out there somewhere. No chance they could've forgotten someone like you.

CRD_ROM_Date_65.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_65.text: My past is a little like yours. No wonder we get along.

CRD_ROM_Date_63.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_63.text: Cut from the same cloth, some might say.

CRD_ROM_Date_152.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_152.text: Honestly, I don't like to talk about my past. I'm far more interested in our future.

CRD_ROM_Date_39.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_39.text: I'm from Baldur's Gate, too. I wonder if we ever crossed paths.

CRD_ROM_Date_225.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_225.text: Might've, if you spent any time in the Outer City. We didn't exactly hide ourselves under a bushel.

CRD_ROM_Date_175.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_175.text: I grew up in a crèche, like most gith. Not much fun to be had, but plenty of discipline.

CRD_ROM_Date_186.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_186.text: It's one of the things I love about you - your ability to see things through.

CRD_ROM_Date_158.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_158.text: I'm from another realm entirely. It would be difficult to explain.

CRD_ROM_Date_154.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_154.text: You don't have to explain, if you don't want to. But whatever time I have left, I'd like to spend getting to know you, exactly as you are.

CRD_ROM_Date_54.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_54.text: I grew up in the Underdark - not for the faint of heart.

CRD_ROM_Date_200.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_200.text: That explains your grit. And your strength. And so many other things I love about you.

CRD_ROM_Date_145.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_145.text: No problem. So, what's something you've never told anyone before?

CRD_ROM_Date_147.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_147.text: All right, try this on for size: what's your biggest fear?

CRD_ROM_Date_102.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_102.text: Speak for yourself! I'm being very good indeed.

CRD_ROM_Date_109.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_109.text: So, where did you grow up?

CRD_ROM_Date_9.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_9.text: Oh that's easy. During year two of my fabulous adventure in celibacy in Avernus, I once got so, erm, pent up, I burnt down my field tent.

CRD_ROM_Date_110.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_110.text: Blamed it on an imp and never told a soul the truth. Beat that.

CRD_ROM_Date_189.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_189.text: I often faint at the sight of blood.

CRD_ROM_Date_129.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_129.text: Yeah, I'm very sure. I'd ask for a real secret, but I suppose besides the whole child of Bhaal thing, you've always been an open book.

CRD_ROM_Date_31.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_31.text: We'll have to make some new secrets between us, then.

CRD_ROM_Date_214.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_214.text: Most of my secrets are lost to the ether. It's not the most exciting thing... but I can't swim.

CRD_ROM_Date_33.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_33.text: Aw. Well, if you ever want to learn, I'd love to take you to a little pond I know outside the city. Shallow, safe, and I'd be there to help you float.
CRD_ROM_Date_33.context: NodeContext: Re: teaching SH how to swim

CRD_ROM_Date_213.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_213.text: I once claimed to have read all six volumes of 'Lichen and Its Curative Properties' to impress a comely botanist. Alas, a falsehood.

CRD_ROM_Date_219.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_219.text: You mean you haven't read all six volumes?! Gale Dekarios, I'll never look at you the same.

CRD_ROM_Date_159.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_159.text: I replaced a cousin's sword with a toy blade. A beholder devoured her - pretty funny, all in all.

CRD_ROM_Date_36.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_36.text: You are terrifying. I love it so much.
CRD_ROM_Date_36.context: NodeContext: Stars in her eyes. Talking to Lae'zel

CRD_ROM_Date_51.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_51.text: I stole some of my father's cigars and blamed a servant. Got my arse whipped for it, too.

CRD_ROM_Date_221.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_221.text: Hard to imagine you as a naughty little boy. Who knew he'd grow up to be the very paragon of right-doing?

CRD_ROM_Date_135.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_135.text: I still dream of my old master sometimes. I don't know if I'll ever be rid of him.

CRD_ROM_Date_80.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_80.text: I understand. The people who hurt us have an annoying habit of lingering, one way or another. I'm sorry for what he did to you.

CRD_ROM_Date_210.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_210.text: You deserve better. You deserve the best. I wish I could give it to you for the rest of your life, but I swear it for the rest of mine.

CRD_ROM_Date_180.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_180.text: It'll have to wait - I think our food is coming.

CRD_ROM_Date_127.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter approaches and roughly drops two plates of food and two cups in front of Karlach and player. The food is something other than the choice made by the player. The two cups are two generic cups, can be any liquid inside.(same cine as N348).InternalNodeContext: (same cine as N348).

CRD_ROM_Date_181.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_181.text: Good question. And easy enough, in my case. I'm afraid of dying with regrets. Of living small and giving up the ghost before I've done what I came here to do.

CRD_ROM_Date_111.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_111.text: That means going after the things I love. Including you.

CRD_ROM_Date_88.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_88.text: I'm sure. You've probably killed scarier things blind and bleeding.

CRD_ROM_Date_103.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_103.text: I fear death. They say the gods will claim us in the afterlife, but there's no guarantee.

CRD_ROM_Date_104.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_104.text: No. Particularly not for sinners like us. But if push comes to shove, I'll meet you in the City of Judgement. We'll paint it red.

CRD_ROM_Date_224.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_224.text: I'm afraid of not truly belonging anywhere.

CRD_ROM_Date_100.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_100.text: You belong here. With me. I know I'm not a forever kind of investment, but right here, right now, you are it. You are everything.

CRD_ROM_Date_165.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_165.text: I'm afraid I'm doomed to repeat past mistakes, no matter how I try to avoid them.

CRD_ROM_Date_148.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_148.text: I know what you mean. Changing is hard. Every time I think I've figured it out, boom, there I am again, behaving like some version of me that never learned a damn thing.

CRD_ROM_Date_13.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_13.text: Irrelevance. To leave no wound on my enemies, to stake no claims for my people.

CRD_ROM_Date_70.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_70.text: Impossible. You leave your stamp everywhere you go. Just look at me - absolutely besotted.

CRD_ROM_Date_97.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_97.text: My queen's rejection. To be denied my true worth, after all I've given her.

CRD_ROM_Date_248.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_248.text: I get it. I can't speak for Vlaakith, but I'll always know who you are. The bravest, fiercest, most gorgeous woman in all the Realms.

CRD_ROM_Date_203.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_203.text: To look within and find I've become the devil I appear to be.

CRD_ROM_Date_227.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_227.text: That could never happen. You're the best person I've ever met. Soul and body.
CRD_ROM_Date_227.context: NodeContext: Very earnest and insistent. She won't hear of Wyll speaking ill of himself after everything he sacrificed for her

CRD_ROM_Date_245.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_245.text: For me, it's control. I won't be under someone's thumb ever again.

CRD_ROM_Date_179.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_179.text: Fucking preach. Any rat bastard comes after you again, and I'll destroy them. I promise.

CRD_ROM_Date_43.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_43.text: You might be your own greatest fear, but you're your own greatest strength, too. I see that every time I look at you.

CRD_ROM_Date_174.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_174.text: Oh - hey! Here comes our food.
CRD_ROM_Date_174.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The waiter approaches and roughly drops two plates of food and two cups in front of Karlach and player. The food is something other than the choice made by the player. The two cups are two generic cups, can be any liquid inside.

CRD_ROM_Date_101.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_101.text: Hey, uh, Henk, I think we ordered the -
CRD_ROM_Date_101.context: NodeContext: Karlach looks up at Henk, noticing the food is wrong.

CRD_ROM_Date_162.speaker: Tender Henk
CRD_ROM_Date_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Henk turns back and walks away from the table. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: Vague menace, a 'do not ask questions' spoken when Karlach tries to tell Henk he gave her the wrong food.

CRD_ROM_Date_19.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_19.text: Hey, uh, Honk, I think we ordered the -

CRD_ROM_Date_120.speaker: Tender Honk
CRD_ROM_Date_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Henk turns back and walks away from the table. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_86.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_86.text: Worst guy I ever met. Anyway, how about a toast? Oh - shit!
CRD_ROM_Date_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach shrugs, amused at Henk's horribleness. She reaches for the drink to hold it aloft and propose a toast, but she fumbles it and knocks the glass over, then she back to standard sitting pose. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]NodeContext: Low, laughing, affectionate voice on 'worst guy'. She drop the drink at " Oh-shit!"

CRD_ROM_Date_166.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_166.text: We can use my glass. To us.

CRD_ROM_Date_149.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_149.text: May we live every day like it's our last.
CRD_ROM_Date_149.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player raises their glass in toast, drinks from their cup, and is about to pass it to Karlach to drink, but she's roughly leaned over the table  to grab the player and kiss them. She sits back down, jostling the table again.InternalNodeContext: Same as N238

CRD_ROM_Date_92.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_92.text: 'Cause you never know when your last will come.
CRD_ROM_Date_92.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Camera zoom out implying they're eating and drinking. When it comes back to them, the plates/ cups are gone and the lights are dimmer, implying the passage of time.InternalNodeContext: Same as N239

CRD_ROM_Date_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_25.text: That was great. The food and the company.

CRD_ROM_Date_32.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_32.text: What do you want to do now?

CRD_ROM_Date_169.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_169.text: You know what I want to do.
CRD_ROM_Date_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

CRD_ROM_Date_71.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_71.text: Lovely having a normal evening amid the chaos.

CRD_ROM_Date_57.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_57.text: Whatever do you mean? We're just two normal people living normal lives very, very normally.
CRD_ROM_Date_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

CRD_ROM_Date_195.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_195.text: I know I can't stay forever. Here. With you. In fact, I feel like... like I don't have long left at all.

CRD_ROM_Date_98.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_98.text: We've been through so much, and the worst is yet to come. I have every reason to feel terrified... hopeless... like giving up.

CRD_ROM_Date_241.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_241.text: But to be here, with you, in the city I love, in this world that I love so much... It's all I could really ask for.

CRD_ROM_Date_77.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_77.text: You hear me? You're all I could ever ask for. I love you. And I know that whatever else this city will throw at us, we can handle it.

CRD_ROM_Date_231.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_231.text: Come on. There's something I want to show you upstairs.
CRD_ROM_Date_231.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She releases the player's hand.

CRD_ROM_Date_40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of non-sexual intimacy.

Karlach reaches up to hold the player's face and scooches forward to kiss their forehad and cheek, then a chaste but sweet peck on the lips.Player and Karlach fall asleep wrapped in each other's arms.

CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black that opens on the player and Karlach in one of the rooms in the inn. This will be a scene of sexual intimacy. (The following is open to interpretation/ details can and should evolve to suit cinematic + actor needs)

She bends down and kisses the player, then rolls to lay beside them, touching them intimately with one hand while she kisses them. Things escalate from there.

CRD_ROM_Date_220.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_220.text: I rented us a room for the whole night. Just the two of us - alone, finally.

CRD_ROM_Date_7.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_7.text: I'll happily head upstairs with you, but I want to make sure I'm clear about not wanting to sleep together.

CRD_ROM_Date_5.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_5.text: I just want to be with you, however you like. You're in control.

CRD_ROM_Date_118.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_118.text: I think I should say goodnight here, Karlach.

CRD_ROM_Date_46.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_46.text: Oh. All right. Well - good night. I had a great time with you. Really great. I... hope you did too.

CRD_ROM_Date_94.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_94.text: Let's get out of here. I need you.

CRD_ROM_Date_91.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_91.text: I was half-hoping some bandits would burst in and give us something to do.

CRD_ROM_Date_114.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_114.text: Looks like I need to find a more active way to entertain you.
CRD_ROM_Date_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] She reaches across the table o the player, takes their hands in hers.

CRD_ROM_Date_185.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_185.text: Hey! Oaves have feelings too. I don't know why I'm nervous. Looks like we'll have to raise your glass.

CRD_ROM_Date_182.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_182.text: Sorry, sorry. Hope they don't stain. Care to raise your glass to that?
CRD_ROM_Date_182.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Player raises their glass in toast, drinks from their cup, and is about to pass it to Karlach to drink, but she's roughly leaned over the table  to grab the player and kiss them. She sits back down, jostling the table again.InternalNodeContext: Same as N52

CRD_ROM_Date_156.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_156.text: Here's to living every day like it's our last.
CRD_ROM_Date_156.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Camera zoom out implying they're eating and drinking. When it comes back to them, the plates/ cups are gone and the lights are dimmer, implying the passage of time.InternalNodeContext: Same as N53

CRD_ROM_Date_1.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_1.text: It'll have to wait - I think our food is coming.

CRD_ROM_Date_122.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_122.text: You're right. What should we do?

CRD_ROM_Date_90.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_90.text: Hmm. Ask me a question, maybe. A getting-to-know-you type question.

CRD_ROM_Date_107.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_107.text: You know, it does. There's always a bit of a veil about you - I guess it's the magic, but there's something else, too. Something I want to discover first-hand.

CRD_ROM_Date_113.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_113.text: Everything about you is new to me, honey. You're the first gith I've met, sure, but you're also singular in the world for so many other reasons.

CRD_ROM_Date_34.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_34.text: I'm not sure. I feel like I saw the heart of you from the very beginning. And I've had a piece of you with me ever since.

CRD_ROM_Date_62.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_62.text: Hmm. Partially. On the one hand, you're dangerous temptation itself. On the other, there's something very frank about you. Something familiar.

CRD_ROM_Date_216.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_216.text: It does. There's so much about you I don't know, but I'm hungry for every part of it.

CRD_ROM_Date_207.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_207.text: Like you, I wear my heart on my sleeve. Can't we skip the pleasantries?

CRD_ROM_Date_128.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_128.text: You're right. Small talk is for small people. And we loom large. But still - first date. So let's make with the first-dating.

CRD_ROM_Date_134.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_134.text: Pretty straightforward: kill the monsters, save the townsfolk, bish bash bosh.

CRD_ROM_Date_76.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_76.text: Kill the monsters, save the townsfolk, sweep the local hellbeast off her feet?

CRD_ROM_Date_177.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_177.text: That was an unexpected and very welcome twist.

CRD_ROM_Date_155.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_155.text: I don't think I could knock you off your feet if I tried.

CRD_ROM_Date_131.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_131.text: True! Then let's say you... brought me to my knees.

CRD_ROM_Date_196.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_196.text: You're not a hell-beast. You're a hell-champion.

CRD_ROM_Date_68.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_68.text: You speak true! And now I'll claim my reward for my labours escaping the evil archdevil: you.

CRD_ROM_Date_85.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_85.text: Gods, we're terrible at this. This was supposed to be a first date, but it's all I can do to keep my hands to myself.

CRD_ROM_Date_83.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_83.text: The grilled rothé ribs sound good.

CRD_ROM_Date_75.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_75.text: Just what I had in mind.
CRD_ROM_Date_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_228.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_228.text: Two of the rothé ribs, please. And two glasses of...
CRD_ROM_Date_228.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

CRD_ROM_Date_236.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_236.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_48.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_48.text: Two pumpkin stews, my good man. And two glasses of...
CRD_ROM_Date_48.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

CRD_ROM_Date_23.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_23.text: A simple bowl of gruel for me.

CRD_ROM_Date_61.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_61.text: Why's that even on the menu? Then again, if it's good enough for you, I suppose it's good enough for me too.
CRD_ROM_Date_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Karlach delivered the line, she beckons the waiter over while still holding menu with left hand. Please reach out to Greg for staging/characters/props placaments ref [CHOICES]

CRD_ROM_Date_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_17.text: A duo of your finest gruel, please. And two glasses of...
CRD_ROM_Date_17.context: NodeContext: She looks to the player expectantly, waiting for their drink order.

CRD_ROM_Date_132.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_132.text: I just need a little while to prepare.

CRD_ROM_Date_141.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_141.text: Don't keep me waiting too long!

CRD_ROM_Date_206.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_206.text: What did you have in mind?

CRD_ROM_Date_96.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_96.text: There's a little spot I know in town. Out of the way, but the view of the city is incredible.

CRD_ROM_Date_205.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_205.text: I just think we ought to slow things down.

CRD_ROM_Date_201.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_201.text: I'm sorry, but I don't have time for that. Literally. I care about you, but I'm not going to chase after you.

CRD_ROM_Date_243.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_243.text: I like you, but I'm not sure I'm ready to take things to the next level.

CRD_ROM_Date_211.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_211.text: So you can lap me up like dessert, but a meal together is taking things too far?

CRD_ROM_Date_137.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_137.text: I get it. I didn't mean to overstep. There's just so much I want to do in the little time I have left.

CRD_ROM_Date_50.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_50.text: If this is it for us, I accept that. But I'd like to find someone who's keen to have a nice meal with me while I still can.

CRD_ROM_Date_28.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_28.text: I'm sure you can understand that.

CRD_ROM_Date_24.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_24.text: I'm just not interested in you.

CRD_ROM_Date_242.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_242.text: After... after everything? Everything you said? Everything I said? You...

CRD_ROM_Date_41.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_41.text: I need a minute. I need a lot of minutes. Please.

CRD_ROM_Date_204.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_204.text: Cliff diving? Naked horse riding? Duelling a troll?

CRD_ROM_Date_74.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_74.text: Even crazier than that, if you can believe it.

CRD_ROM_Date_191.speaker: Player
CRD_ROM_Date_191.text: I'm not sure my orifices are ready.

CRD_ROM_Date_136.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_136.text: A little inn in the city - the Singing Lute, it's called. If it's anything like it used to be, we'll have the place all to ourselves.

CRD_ROM_Date_222.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_222.text: I'm buying, all right? Let it be said, let it be written, let it be done.

CRD_ROM_Date_226.speaker: Karlach
CRD_ROM_Date_226.text: Hup hup, eh? I haven't got forever.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_5.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_5.text: Hey, soldier. We've got a long way ahead of us - and there's something I want to tell you.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_17.text: Don't worry. It's nothing bad. Well. Depending.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_49.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_49.text: Hey, soldier. I'm getting a little nervous. We're getting further and further from those pricks who were hunting me.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_30.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_30.text: I'm not willing to let servants of Zariel roam the Sword Coast unchecked. Or to regroup and come after me again. Let's go get 'em. Together.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_9.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_9.text: I already took care of those Paladins of Tyr  - you don't need to worry about them anymore.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_2.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_2.text: You... did? Wow. That was sound of you. Why'd you do it?
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_2.context: NodeContext: Wanting to accept the favor but experience has made her wary of trusting (this is early in her relationship to the player)

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_3.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_3.text: I always take care of my people.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_43.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_43.text: Glad to be counted among them. Really glad.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_33.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_33.text: Wish I could've been there to watch those ignots crumble, but I'm just happy they're off my tail.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_1.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_1.text: They were agents of a devil. I wasn't going to let them roam the area unchallenged.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_15.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_15.text: I'm always keen for a good fight.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_50.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_50.text: Same. Wish you would've brought me along for the ride, but I'm just happy those ignots are off my tail.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_18.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_18.text: Then again, facing 'em down might've put my tin can into overdrive.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_18.context: NodeContext: She's about to explain her infernal heart for the first time.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_32.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_32.text: Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Thing's been running in overdrive since I left Avernus.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_32.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)NodeContext: A bit more tired/ worn out than when she says this in Act 1 (this is only if she hasn't told player about her heart by act 2)

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_7.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_7.text: Won't be seeing my mechanic any time soon, so I've been making the most of the extra heat. But it's meant I can't get too friendly. If I'm excited, nervous, scared, I'll light you up like a firework.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_6.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_6.text: How the hells did you get an infernal engine for a heart?

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_23.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_23.text: High pain tolerance. And a dynamic duo of truly shitty bosses.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_45.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_45.text: You have a mechanic for your heart?

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_11.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_11.text: Wild, right? And believe it or not, I'm one of Zariel's least-mutilated pets.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_19.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_19.text: What does the engine allow you to do?

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_10.text: Burn, baby. As hot as I can tolerate. I have to admit it helps in battle, though I wouldn't have chosen it for myself - if I'd been given a choice.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_10.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_37.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_37.text: I'll tell you the story, but I really need to find someone who can tune up my engine sooner rather than later. Believe me when I say this thing is hot.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_21.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_21.text: The first time I faced down those 'paladins,' they let slip they'd met an infernal mechanic in the area. A tiefling. But I didn't see him anywhere.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_47.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_47.text: Wonder if they meant Dammon - a tiefling weaponsmith.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_0.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_0.text: A weaponsmith, huh? Not sure if he's the guy, but I'd love to find out. A tune-up would do this rusty heart a world of good.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_35.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_35.text: There are some tieflings holed up in a druid's grove nearby. We might look there.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_51.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_51.text: Sounds like a good lead. Hopefully, our guy will be among them. A tune-up would do this old tub a world of good.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_34.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_34.text: I'll keep an eye out for someone like that.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_8.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_8.text: Thanking you. A tune-up would give this rustbox of mine a new lease on life.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_46.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_46.text: What'll happen if you don't get tuned up?

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_16.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_16.text: Who knows! Maybe I can run like this indefinitely. But... maybe not.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_4.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_4.text: I met someone who might be able to help - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_40.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_40.text: Well now! Maybe I could make his acquaintance? A tightened screw or two might let me keep a little calmer.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_48.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_48.text: Maybe even manage a pat or bump without burning someone to death. It's been a long time.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_39.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_39.text: If you can lead the way, I'll gladly follow.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_22.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_22.text: Agreed. We'll make sure they can't hurt anyone again.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_41.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_41.text: We have important things to do, Karlach. Cutting down Zariel's lackeys isn't one of them.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_12.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_12.text: It's important to me. Are you going to help me or not?
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_12.context: NodeContext: If this goes badly, she could leave the party. So medium tension.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_38.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_38.text: If it's that important to you, you have my support. We'll find them together.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_20.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_20.text: Before we head off, there's something I want you to know.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_25.speaker: Player
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_25.text: It's not a priority. Get in line or go it alone.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_36.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_36.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The player has said they aren't going to solve her quest with her.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_42.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_42.text: If this is really goodbye, soldier, I guess... well... thanks for everything. I'd hoped we'd be able to stick together a bit longer, but that's life, isn't it.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_42.context: NodeContext: Surprised. The player has said they aren't going to solve her quest with her.

CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_26.speaker: Karlach
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_26.text: Good luck. I'm gonna miss you. You better miss me too. Or else.
CRD_PaladinsOfTyrAndEngine_26.context: NodeContext: Leaving the party and sad about it, but hiding behind a bit of humor as a defense.
